N1.name: EKS Cluster Endpoint Access Control
N1.description: Check if the cluster endpoint is properly configured with restricted public access

N2.name: Multi-AZ Node Distribution
N2.description: Check if worker nodes are properly distributed across multiple availability zones for high availability

N3.name: Private Subnet Node Deployment
N3.description: Check if worker nodes are deployed in private subnets for enhanced security

N4.name: VPC CNI Managed Add-on Usage
N4.description: Check if the cluster uses AWS VPC CNI and whether it's deployed as an EKS managed add-on for better security and maintenance

N5.name: VPC CNI Service Account IAM Role
N5.description: Check if VPC CNI uses a dedicated service account with proper IAM role instead of using node instance profile

N6.name: Subnet IP Address Availability
N6.description: Check if subnets have sufficient available IP addresses and recommend solutions for IP exhaustion

N7.name: Load Balancer Target Type Configuration
N7.description: Check if Ingress and LoadBalancer services use IP target mode instead of instance mode for better IP efficiency

N8.name: PreStop Hook Configuration for Ingress Deployments
N8.description: Check if Deployments behind Ingress resources have PreStop hooks configured for graceful connection draining

N9.name: Kube-Proxy Mode for Service Scale
N9.description: Check if kube-proxy mode is appropriate for the number of services in the cluster (IPVS recommended for >1000 services)
